productText:
000
FZUS52 KTAE 151445
CWFTAE

Coastal Waters Forecast for Florida Big Bend and eastern Panhandle
National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
1045 AM EDT Thu Jun 15 2023

Gulf coastal waters from the mouth of the Suwannee River to
Okaloosa-Walton County Line out to 60 nm.

Seas are provided as a range of the average height of the highest
1/3 of the waves...along with the occasional height of the
average highest 1/10 of the waves. 

GMZ700-152245-
Synopsis for the Suwannee River to Okaloosa-Walton county Line
out to 60 nm
1045 AM EDT Thu Jun 15 2023

.SYNOPSIS...

Unsettled weather is likely the next few days with multiple 
rounds of showers and thunderstorms moving near or across the 
waters. Thunderstorms will be capable of strong gusty winds, hail,
waterspouts and frequent lightning. Otherwise, generally 
southwest winds are expected with periods of exercise caution 
conditions, especially within the nearshore waters.

$$

GMZ770-772-775-152245-
Waters from Mexico Beach to Okaloosa Walton County Line FL from
20 to 60 NM-
Waters from Apalachicola to Mexico Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM-
Waters from  Suwannee River to Apalachicola FL from 20 to 60 NM-
1045 AM EDT Thu Jun 15 2023 /945 AM CDT Thu Jun 15 2023/

.THIS AFTERNOON...Southwest winds around 15 knots. Seas 3 to
4 feet with a dominant period of 6 seconds. Showers and
thunderstorms likely late this morning and early afternoon, then
a chance of showers and thunderstorms late. 
.TONIGHT...Southwest winds 15 to 20 knots. Seas around 4 feet
with a dominant period of 6 seconds. A chance of showers and
thunderstorms. 
.FRIDAY...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 3 to 4 feet with a
dominant period of 6 seconds. Showers and thunderstorms likely. 
.FRIDAY NIGHT...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas around
3 feet with a dominant period of 6 seconds. A chance of showers
and thunderstorms in the evening, then showers and thunderstorms
likely after midnight. 
.SATURDAY...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with a
dominant period of 6 seconds. Showers and thunderstorms. 
.SATURDAY NIGHT...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas around 3 feet
with a dominant period of 6 seconds. A chance of showers and
thunderstorms. 
.SUNDAY...West winds around 10 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with a
dominant period of 5 seconds. Showers and thunderstorms likely. 
.SUNDAY NIGHT...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet
with a dominant period of 5 seconds. A chance of showers and
thunderstorms. 
.MONDAY...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 4 feet with a
dominant period of 5 seconds. A chance of showers and
thunderstorms. 
.MONDAY NIGHT...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 3 to 5 feet,
occasionally to 6 feet with a dominant period of 6 seconds. A
chance of showers and thunderstorms. 

Winds and seas higher in and near thunderstorms.

$$

GMZ730-750-752-755-765-152245-
Apalachee Bay or Coastal Waters From Keaton Beach to Ochlockonee
River FL out to 20 Nm-
Coastal waters from Mexico Beach to Okaloosa Walton County Line
FL out 20 NM-
Coastal waters from Mexico Beach to Apalachicola FL out 20 NM-
Coastal Waters From  Ochlockonee River to Apalachicola Fl out to
20 Nm-
Coastal waters from  Suwannee River to Keaton Beach FL out 20 NM-
1045 AM EDT Thu Jun 15 2023 /945 AM CDT Thu Jun 15 2023/

...SMALL CRAFT SHOULD EXERCISE CAUTION...

.THIS AFTERNOON...Southwest winds 15 to 20 knots. Seas 2 to
4 feet with a dominant period of 5 seconds. Protected waters
choppy. Showers and thunderstorms likely late this morning and
early afternoon, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms late.
.TONIGHT...Southwest winds 15 to 20 knots. Seas 3 to 4 feet with
a dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters choppy. A chance
of showers and thunderstorms. 
.FRIDAY...West winds 15 to 20 knots, diminishing to 10 to
15 knots in the afternoon. Seas 2 to 4 feet with a dominant
period of 6 seconds. Protected waters choppy. Showers and
thunderstorms likely. 
.FRIDAY NIGHT...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with
a dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters a moderate chop.
A chance of showers and thunderstorms in the evening, then
showers and thunderstorms likely after midnight. 
.SATURDAY...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with a
dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters a moderate chop.
Showers and thunderstorms. 
.SATURDAY NIGHT...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet
with a dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters a moderate
chop. A chance of showers and thunderstorms. 
.SUNDAY...West winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with a
dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters a moderate chop. A
chance of showers and thunderstorms. 
.SUNDAY NIGHT...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet
with a dominant period of 5 seconds. Protected waters a moderate
chop. A chance of showers and thunderstorms. 
.MONDAY...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 3 feet with a
dominant period of 5 seconds. Protected waters a moderate chop. A
chance of showers and thunderstorms. 
.MONDAY NIGHT...Southwest winds 10 to 15 knots. Seas 2 to 4 feet
with a dominant period of 6 seconds. Protected waters a moderate
chop. A chance of showers and thunderstorms. 

Winds and waves higher in and near thunderstorms.

$$
